UP would keep me on the left wall but leaves me with only two follow-up moves next turn (UP or RIGHT, since DOWN would back into myself and LEFT is off-board), while RIGHT moves me into the middle and leaves three follow-up options (UP, RIGHT, or DOWN) and keeps me closer to the apple row without risking any immediate collision with Snake #0 on the far right edge. Staying on the bottom of the board isn’t risky either, so RIGHT is the safer, more flexible choice.

Plan note: Keep moving right along y=4 if it stays safe, so I end on a square with multiple exits and stay as close as possible to the apple cluster for the final turn.

RIGHT
